fromElement

public java.lang.Object fromElement(XMLSimpleReader reader,
                                    MappingContext mappingContext,
                                    java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                    java.lang.String format,
                                    java.lang.Class targetType,
                                    java.lang.Object targetObject)
Description copied from interface: ElementConverter
Method responsible for reading a complete xml node from XMLSimpleReader and returning deserialized Object that corresponds to this node. When XMLSimpleReader instance is passed to this method it is already positioned on the xml node that is to be converted. Method can inspect all node's attributes, value and subnodes. When method returns, the reader MUST be positioned on the end of the same node as it was when entering method.

Specified by:
fromElement in interface ElementConverter
Parameters:
reader - XMLSimpleReader to read XML data from.
defaultValue - Default value to use if xml element is empty.
format - Format string passed in from @XMLelement(format="..."). Used to set conversion options.
Returns:
Deserialized object.

toElement

public void toElement(java.lang.Object object,
                      javax.xml.namespace.QName elementName,
                      XMLSimpleWriter writer,
                      MappingContext mappingContext,
                      java.lang.String defaultValue,
                      java.lang.String format)
Description copied from interface: ElementConverter
Takes an Object and serializes it to a XML element and writes it out to XmlSimpleWriter. Method must write out the whole XML element including closing tag.

Specified by:
toElement in interface ElementConverter
Parameters:
object - Object to be serialized. If it is null then no element must be written.
elementName - The name of the XML element.
writer - XmlSimpleWriter to write data to.
defaultValue - If serialized object equals default value (for simple elements), then an empty element
format - Format string passed in from @XMLelement(format="..."). Used to set conversion options.
